Literature Review: Tomato brown rugose fruit virus (ToBRFV) is an emerging threat to global agriculture, particularly affecting tomato and pepper crops. First identified in 2015 in Jordan, ToBRFV has rapidly spread to various regions, including Europe, Asia, and North America, posing significant challenges to crop management and disease control. This review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the current knowledge on ToBRFV, focusing on its discovery, distribution, epidemiology, detection methods, and strategies for prevention and control.
